newsitem.title: JAPAN: Nissan Feb domestic output up 9.4% yr/yr.
newsitem.headline: Nissan Feb domestic output up 9.4% yr/yr.

text.p: Nissan Motor Co Ltd said on Friday its domestic vehicle production in February rose 9.4 percent from a year earlier to 159,653 vehicles.
Nissan's February exports rose 18.1 percent from a year earlier to 53,579 vehicles.
Nissan's February domestic production rose for a second successive month on a year-on-year basis, reflecting higher domestic sales and exports.
Its vehicle exports rose for the sixth straight month due to higher exports to Asia, Oceania and the Middle East, a Nissan spokeswoman said.

Nissan's domestic sales rose for a fourth month in a row, reflecting good demand for new recreational vehicles and remodelled cars such as its Stagea, Rasheen and Cefiro, she said. Its overseas output rose for an eighth straight month, reflecting higher output at its Mexican and British units.
Nissan's domestic vehicle production, exports, domestic sales and overseas output in February were as follows:
